· Degree in Library Science, Information Systems, Linguistics or equivalent professional experience · 5+ years of relevant work experience working in ontology and/or taxonomy roles · Proven skills in data retrieval and data research techniques · Ability to quickly understand complex processes and communicate them in simple language · Experience creating and communicating technical requirements to engineering teams · Ability to communicate to senior leadership (Director and VP levels) · Knowledge of Semantic Web technologies (RDF/s, OWL), query languages (SPARQL) and validation/reasoning standards (SHACL, SPIN) · Knowledge of open-source and commercial ontology engineering editors (e.g. Protege, TopQuadrant products, PoolParty) · Detail-oriented problem solver who is able to work in fast-changing environment and manage ambiguity · Proven track record of strong communication and interpersonal skills · Proficient English language skills         Ontology Product Knowledge Team     The vision of the Ontology Product Knowledge Team is to provide a standardized, semantically rich, easily discoverable, extensible, and universally applicable body of product knowledge that can be consistently utilized across customer shopping experiences, selling partner listing experiences and internal enrichment of product data. We aim to make product knowledge compelling, easy to use, and feature rich. Our work to build comprehensive product knowledge allows us to semantically understand a customer’s intent – whether that is a shopping mission or a seller offering products. We strive to make these experiences more intuitive for all customers.                    As an Ontologist, you work on a global team of knowledge builders to deliver world-class, intuitive, and comprehensive taxonomy and ontology models to optimize product discovery for Amazon web and mobile experiences. You collaborate with business partners and engineering teams to deliver knowledge-based solutions to enable product discoverability for customers. In this role, you will directly impact the customer experience as well as the company’s product knowledge foundation.           Tasks and Responsibilities :                Develop logical, semantically rich, and extensible data models for Amazon's extensive product catalog     Ensure our ontologies provide comprehensive domain coverage that are available for both human and machine ingestion and inference     Analyze website metrics and product discovery behaviors to make data-driven decisions on optimizing our knowledge graph data models globally     Expand and refine the expansion of data retrieval techniques to utilize our extensive knowledge graph      Contribute to team goal setting and future state vision     Drive and coordinate cross-functional projects with a broad range of merchandisers, engineers, designers, and other groups that may include architecting new data solutions     Develop team operational excellence programs, data quality initiatives and process simplifications     Evangelize ontology and semantic technologies within and across teams at Amazon     Develop and refine data governance and processes used by global Ontologists      Mentor and influence peers                   Inclusive Team Culture     We celebrate diverse cultures and backgrounds within our team and our customer base. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion, offering continuous access to internal affinity groups as well as highlighting diversity programs.           Work/Life Harmony     Our team believes that striking the right balance between work and your outside life is key. Our work is not removed from everyday life, but instead is influenced by it. Our team understands that life is not cut-and-dry; we recognize that your personal commitments are as important as your work commitments, and welcome an open and honest dialog about how to accommodate your working schedule.           Career Development:             We value developing you as an Amazonian. We recognize each team member as an individual, and we will build on your skills to help you grow. Our team has a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we are building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing. We care about your career development, from your initial company introduction and training sessions, to continuous support throughout your tenure at Amazon.      You will have the opportunity to support the customer experience used by millions of customers daily and to work with data at a scale very few companies can offer.      We have offices in six locations around the globe. We will consider candidate placement in: Seattle, Munich, Japan, New York, Bangalore and Dublin.            Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation       · Master’s degree in Library Science, Information Systems, Linguistics or other relevant fields · Experience building ontologies in the e-commerce and semantic search spaces · Experience working with schema-level constructs (e.g. higher-level classes, punning, property inheritance) · Proficiency in SQL, SPARQL · Familiarity with software engineering life cycle · Familiarity with ontology manipulation programming libraries · Exposure to data science and/or machine learning, including graph embeddings · Additional language skills, e.g. Arabic or French

Ramp is building the next generation of finance tools—from corporate cards and expense management, to bill payments and accounting integrations—designed to save businesses time and money with every click. Over 5000 businesses are spending an average of 3.3% less and closing their books 8 times faster, thanks to Ramp’s finance automation platform that enables billions of dollars of purchases each year.  Founded in 2019, Ramp has seen nearly 10x year-over-year growth which has led to a valuation of $8.1 billion in just over 3 years. Its investors include Founders Fund, Stripe, Citi, Goldman Sachs, Coatue Management, D1 Capital Partners, Redpoint Ventures and Thrive Capital, as well as over 100 angel investors who were founders or executives of leading companies. The team is made up of talented leaders from some of the leading financial services and fintech companies—Capital One, Stripe, Affirm, Goldman Sachs, American Express, Visa—as well as high-growth technology companies like Facebook, Spotify, Zendesk, Uber, Dropbox, and Instacart. Recently named Fast Company’s most innovative finance company, Ramp is NYC’s fastest-growing startup and America’s fastest-growing corporate card.  About the Role  Ramp is in a critical phase of growth and this role is responsible for executing projects and initiatives that will drive new customers to Ramp. You’ll work directly with our growth leaders to drive mission-critical, cross-functional projects across the organization. You will collaborate closely with our Sales, Marketing, Engineering, Product, Risk, and Operations teams to deliver on ambitious growth goals. This is a key role where you will be uniquely positioned to impact the full picture of Ramp’s growth efforts across all functions.  What You’ll Do   Help drive and influence the growth strategy for NYC’s fastest growing startup  Work to drive net new leads for Ramp by supporting data driven experimentation  Measure the impact of growth experiments end-to-end  Solve complex business problems and build / iterate on process for a wide range of go-to-market and operational needs within a high-growth startup by working cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing, Engineering, Product, Risk, and Operations  Support bottom-up planning  Past growth initiatives include:  Building dashboards to monitor performance of growth activities and data infrastructure  Specing and building internal tools to reduce the time to execute operations processes by 95%  Designing and training a machine learning model to code email response sentiment to automate sales reporting  AB testing ramp.com landing pages to improve conversion  Managing and streamlining sales onboarding processes   What You’ll Need   2+ years of total experience including work in analytics at a high-growth technology company  Proficient in SQL  You have a “get things done” mentality; you can dissect complex problems, identify solutions, and drive these solutions to completion with a high degree of autonomy  You are creative and can see how the pieces of a complex problem fit together; you feel comfortable challenging assumptions when they are not well-based  You like to build - you enjoy the process of going from problem to solution regardless of the medium  You’re a master with data analysis, and have an exceptional ability to draw key insights from both quantitative and qualitative data  You have a team-first mentality and communication skills that allow you to influence others at all levels and across all functions within the organization to rally behind shared business goals   Nice to Haves:   Additional experience in management consulting, investment banking or investing Statistical literacy and financial modeling skills  Proficiency in Python  Experience in growth specific analytics (e.g. paid marketing platforms)  Experience with no code tools (eg Zapier, Webflow), Salesforce, and Hubspot   Ramp Benefits   100% medical, dental & vision insurance coverage for you  Partially covered for your dependents  OneMedical annual membership  401k (including employer match)  Unlimited PTO  Annual education reimbursement  WFH stipend to support your home office needs  Monthly wellness stipend; Headspace annual membership  Parental Leave  Relocation support

## Senior DevOps Engineer Job Description   We are in search of a self-motivated and versatile senior devops engineer with the ability to work in an energetic and interactive environment. You must be a self-starter with a passion for crafting innovative software solutions. You will regularly learn and implement new technologies, and play an active role in developing, proving out, and (re)assessment of existing architectures.   ABOUT MOODY'S ANALYTICS MACHINE LEARNING TEAM   We are a team that creates and delivers machine learning models and applications for the financial services industry. At a high level, we ingest millions of news articles and other various data sources and process the data through pipelines to produce results such as entity recognition, sentiment analysis, credit adversity, and more.   Interested in machine learning? Take advantage of our growing team's collective knowledge and learn as you go. We fully embrace cross-training and continuous learning.   JOB RESPONSIBILITIES      Deployment and productionisation or machine learning model applications in production.    Lead the team in various aspects around stability, application delivery, and availability .    Contribute to the growth of the team and continuous learning.    Design and development of Terraform and Ansible modules.    Maintain a strong security awareness through frequent assessments and software architecture design processes.    Influence technology selection, software architecture design, security practices and implementation.     JOB REQUIREMENTS      Extensive experience in DevOps engineering, team management, and collaboration.    Be ready, willing, and able to work in a fast-paced environment with a strong desire to run to trouble.    Proficiency in shell scripting, python, and  HCL .    Knowledge and experience working with distributed systems.    Extensive knowledge & experience with git, linux system administration, docker, and databases including elasticsearch and MySQL.    Kubernetes expert administrator with a security mindset.    Capable of orchestrating service delivery across over 20 distributed kubernetes clusters.    Extensive knowledge of cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.    Strong communication and problem-solving skills with the ability to discuss projects with colleagues who have little technical knowledge of devops techniques and tools.    Ability to oversee and provide significant valuable input regarding infrastructure design and maintenance.     Job Type: Full-time

About Happify Health  Happify Health is a clinical grade technology company that develops personalized digital therapeutics and care solutions for the modern healthcare cloud.  We are pioneering a new era of care through Intelligent Healing™️ that makes healthcare more precise, connected, and responsive for pharma, health plans, enterprises, and individuals everywhere.  With a foundation in science-backed activities and games, Happify Health was inspired by the idea that technology can be used to incite positive change in our industry—and ourselves. This vision is powered by our growing diverse team of leaders, experts, and creators, collaborating closely to challenge the status quo and redefine our systems of care.  We believe that meaningful behavior change is a journey—and that moving towards better health and well-being should be enjoyable. Together, we can create a healthier, happier future through Intelligent Healing™️.  Join us as we usher in a new era of connected care, and strive to heal all people, one person at a time. About the Role  Happify Health's Artificial Intelligence (AI) team utilizes natural language processing (NLP) and deep learning algorithms to develop the next generation of AI clinical applications. This role will join a nimble team of computer scientists and clinical psychologists and will report to the Chief Artificial Intelligence Officer. We are looking for a creative Machine Learning Engineer with strong programming skills to develop and improve our offering personalization services. You will delve into our mounds of data, design suitable machine learning models and algorithms, and implement them on our large-scale data infrastructure. #LI-Remote  Responsibilities   Build, scale and evolve our content personalization and machine learning algorithms  Collaborate with data scientists, machine learning engineers, software engineers, and product managers to understand data needs  Analyze large scale data sets and extract meaningful information to improve our service offerings, user experience, and content ecosystem  Innovate on optimizing Happify content consumption and user experience through personalization  Take an active interest in our wellness and wellbeing features and bring the best content and services to users   Qualifications   Strong educational background in machine learning, computer science, or equivalent  3+ years of hands-on experience in developing industrial search/recommendation/feed/ads retrieval or ranking models  Deep knowledge of ranking algorithms such as CF, FM, Wide & Deep, DeepFM and Multi-modal  Experience solving real-world recommendation problems such as cold-start, long-tail, presentation biases, etc.  Proficiency in building algorithms using at least one of the frameworks: Pytorch(preferred), Tensorflow, ScikitLearn, ONNX  Proficiency in Python/C++  Experience working with transformer models, sequence models, and natural language processing is a plus  Experience developing algorithms under computational constraints, including memory and computation optimization  Strong coding skills in live product environments, going through full product life-cycle  Experience with Cloud computing platforms like Azure, and AWS  Passion for psychology and/or mental health is strongly preferred Happify values candidates with different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We do not discriminate based upon ethnicity, age, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, socioeconomic status, disability, or veteran status. We're committed to building a company that is an inclusive environment for all.  There have been cases of scams targeting candidates by individuals pretending to work at Happify. We will never ask you to share financial information to participate in our recruiting process. If you suspect that you've been contacted by a scammer, please consider filing a report with law enforcement. If you'd like to verify an email you received from Happify, please write us at verify@happify.com.

The partners at Seven Eight Capital have a long track record of successfully implementing quantitative trading strategies in the global equity markets and have delivered superior risk-adjusted returns regardless of market conditions. At Seven Eight Capital, research is about working with the smartest quants on Wall Street to better model the markets. Seven Eight is built on the idea of hiring the best research team we can, and enabling those researchers to reach their full potential. Machine Learning is critical to what we do, and we have significant in-house expertise to help keep us on top of the latest trends.  Do you want to learn about Risk Modelling, Alpha Generation, Portfolio Construction and Trade Execution? Our researchers can gain exposure to all parts of the business. And to enable our researchers, we have a top-notch technology group, producing the best tools available.  Ideal candidates will have the following skill sets:   BS / MS from top tier university with a focus on Statistics / Applied Math / Computer Science / Machine Learning & AI / Engineering.  Strong Python skills for conducting research  Programmer with strong hands-on OOP skills in C++ or Java.  Experience in Linux scripting is a plus.  Strong research skills, preference for research applied to large financial data sets.  A general understanding of optimization theory, linear / non-linear models, machine learning techniques and various financial models (Risk models & T-Cost models) is a plus.  Ability to clearly communicate, think independently and be an excellent problem solver. The position is well suited for an entrepreneurial spirit

C3.ai, Inc. (NYSE:AI) is a leading provider of Enterprise AI software for accelerating digital transformation. The proven C3 AI Suite provides comprehensive services to build enterprise-scale AI applications more efficiently and cost-effectively than alternative approaches. The core of the C3 AI offering is an open, data-driven AI architecture that dramatically simplifies data science and application development. Learn more at: www.c3.ai Industry Solutions Leader performs a combination of Technical Project Management, Product Development, and Business Development. We work at the leading edge of our business, driving cross-functional efforts to apply C3 AI Solutions to complex predictive and prescriptive problems in new domains and for new customers. Solutions Leaders identify and quantify high-impact business opportunities, scope them to tractable AI/ML problems, then drive the delivery of solutions with compelling business value. Team members have 10-20 years of consulting, and software engineering experience.  Recent examples of successful engagements at C3 AI include anti-money laundering, credit decision support, prediction of short sale securities, predicting customer churn, predictive maintenance on capital equipment, supply chain optimization, manufacturing yield optimization, chronic disease prevention, customer spend prediction, and unit-level demand forecasting and allocation. These are impactful projects with high levels of customer and internal visibility.  The Industry Solutions Leader (Financial Services) will bring significant team leadership, drive, and direction to the Financial Services Solutions team.  Your Responsibilities:   Collaborate with decision-makers, IT leaders, Data Science Leads, and subject matter experts in the Banking, Capital Markets, and Insurance industries to identify and frame compelling use cases for the C3 AI offering.  Lead high-performing C3 AI teams including data scientists, solutions engineers, application engineers, and product managers in the delivery of production-ready configurations.  Oversee multiple C3 AI Solutions Consultants and ensure successful, high quality, and high impact delivery of all ongoing projects.  Work as a trusted partner of C3 AI's sales team to define and execute winning account strategies and allocate the right support to the right projects.  Work as a trusted partner of C3 AI's customers to help them define the digital transformation agenda in financial services.  Convert firsthand customer and market experience into impactful input to our product direction and strategy.  Develop and ensure hiring processes and candidate outreach to attract and bring in high-profile candidates.  Regular travel (25+%) to customer sites is required.   Requirements:  Qualified candidates will combine an advanced technical degree with management consulting experience and have a record of successful delivery of complex, multi-faceted projects. Specific requirements are:   Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or similar field, and Master of Science or Business Administration degrees with technical concentrations/expertise.  10+ years of work experience that includes technical problem solving and project delivery in the financial services arena.  Subject matter expertise in one or more of the following areas of financial services: Commercial banking including lending, trade finance, and transaction banking  Retail banking  Payments  Capital markets  Wealth and asset management  Insurance (Life, P&C, or health)  Governance, risk management, and regulatory compliance  Ability to lead and shape AI/ML use case development with customers.  Technical competence in cloud architectures and services.  Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills, and experience in delivering effective presentations to senior executives – decision-makers, IT executives, and SMEs.  Technical, polished, driven, goal-oriented, and proven record of delivery.  Ability to learn quickly with excellent analytical problem-solving skills.  Ability to lead projects and work collaboratively across diverse teams.   Preferred:   Understanding of the competitive landscape in enterprise big data and machine learning platforms.  Programming and application experience in machine learning and artificial intelligence.  Understanding of the data science pipeline.  Master of Science in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Statistics, or similar field.  Competency in public speaking and customer interaction.   C3 AI provides a competitive compensation package and excellent benefits.  C3 AI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. job_Description: Company    Federal Reserve Bank of New York    Working at the Federal Reserve Bank of New York positions you at the center of the financial world with a unique perspective on national and international markets and economies. You will work in an environment with a diverse group of experienced professionals to foster and support the safety, soundness, and vitality of our economic and financial systems. It is a challenge that demands the skills of a financial service professional and the intelligence of an academic—all combined with a passion for public service.        The Bank believes in work flexibility to balance the demands of work and life while also connecting and collaborating with our colleagues in person. Employees can expect to be in the office a couple of days per week as needed for meetings and team collaboration and should live within a commutable distance.                            What we do:                   Enterprise Architecture (EA) consolidates accountability for technology choices and solution design across the Technology Group (TG) and the full portfolio, ensuring consistent leadership in the solution design process. EA:                                    Elevates the discussion and strategic value of technology within each business area and simplifies access to enterprise level architects                                Sets enterprise architecture policies and standards to facilitate uniform, practical, and efficient product development                                Actively engages and collaborates with System IT architects and FRS stakeholders                           The outcome is that FRBNY’s overall architecture blueprint and roadmap are developed and clearly communicated to Business, Technology Leaders and COO, resulting in uniform, practical, and efficient product development in FRBNY as a result of EA policies and guidelines.                         Your role as Data Architect:                                    Contribute to design and maintenance of common data models within assigned domains as part of an overall common data model (including central IT-specification of business objects for technical integration)                                Support coordination of data distribution and consolidation across different sources (IT applications and enterprise data stores)                                Contribute to design of enterprise-wide data solutions ensuring compliance of data integration between applications                                Perform engineering and customization of machine learning, NLP and AI models to match business needs, with ability go beyond the usual configuration of ML models and come up with blended models to meet custom business requirements                                Contribute to design and definition of data engineering best practices/patterns to be implemented as a repeatable process for data ingestion, cleansing, wrangling, and features generation needed for data science                                Ensure project level solutions adhere to strategic direction in terms of the technologies, standards, processes and current/target state architectures for data across the enterprise.                                Ensure project level solutions align with the strategy and architecture for managing enterprise data.                                Ensure project level data governance and data quality best practices align with Enterprise standards.                                Work with project level business and IT stakeholders to ensure data solutions address business and IT objectives.                                Lead design, development, implementation and maintenance efforts of all levels of complexity related to data systems and solutions.                                Develop project level conceptual, logical and physical data models, as well as data integration pipelines to support data analysis and business intelligence solutions.                                Track, evaluate and recommend emerging technologies for relevant data management, data science, storage and analytic technologies.                                Participate in working groups comprised of Federal Reserve System Data architects and Information Management workgroups, and continuous learning through attending data architecture-related conferences, seminars, and events                                Design and implement modern data integration technologies and solutions to support microservices-based application architectures                                Partner with other Application, Data and Infrastructure Architects to deliver best in class solutions                                 You will be an individual contributor residing in EA, and reporting to the Department Head of Data Architecture. You will be an experienced and independent Data Architect professional with demonstrated expertise, business involvement, and ability to work in a matrix operating model and federated environment. Data Scientists on the Disney Streaming Machine Learning and Innovation team develop and maintain recommendation and personalization algorithms for Disney Streaming’s suite of streaming video apps, notably Disney+. They specialize in applying machine learning methods to meet strategic product personalization goals, explore innovative techniques that can be applied to recommendations, and constantly seek ways to optimize operational processes. As a member of this team you will collaborate across Engineering, Product, and Data teams to better understand challenges and develop automated solutions to be built into our products.              Responsibilities :             Algorithm development and maintenance: Utilize cutting edge machine learning methods to develop algorithms for personalization, recommendation, and other predictive systems; maintain algorithms deployed to production and be the point person in explaining methodologies to technical and non-technical teams      Analysis and Algorithm Optimization: Perform deep dive analysis on app interactions and user profiles as they relate to algorithm output in order to drive improvements in key personalization metrics      Data Preparation: Process, cleanse, and verify the integrity of data used for model building, experimentation evaluation, and algorithm performance      MVP development: Develop innovative data science products to be used for new production features or downstream by production algorithms      Development Best Practices: Maintain existing and establish new algorithm development, testing, and deployment standards      Collaborate with product and business stakeholders: Identify and define new personalization opportunities and work with other data teams to improve how we do data collection, experimentation and analysis                 Basic Qualifications :             4+ years of experience developing machine learning models and performing data analysis with Python or R      3+ years writing production-level, scalable code (e.g. Python, Scala)      3+ years of experience developing algorithms for deployment to production systems      In-depth understanding of modern machine learning (e.g. deep learning methods), models, and their mathematical underpinnings      In-depth understanding of the latest in natural language processing techniques and contextualized word embedding models      Experience with cloud services in a production environment (particularly AWS)      Familiarity with data exploration and data visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, Chartio, etc.      Understanding of statistical concepts (e.g., hypothesis testing, regression analysis)      Ability to gauge the complexity of machine learning problems and a willingness to execute simple approaches for quick, effective solutions as appropriate      Strong written and verbal communication skills      Ability to explain how models are used and algorithms behave to both technical and non-technical audiences                 Preferred Qualifications:             Production experience with developing content recommendation algorithms at scale      Production experience with graph based models (e.g. node2vec)      Experience building The Role:  For the last ten years, CB Insights has been aggregating, analyzing, and advising on the trends shaping emerging technology.  Now we're on a mission to connect the companies building the future with the buyers who can propel their businesses forward.  As Product Manager of our Marketplace product line, you're a key player in bringing that to life.  You'll develop the value proposition and experiences for emerging technology vendors to grow awareness, beat their competition, and engage potential investors, acquirers, partners, and customers through the CB Insights platform.  You'll balance the needs of different users, ensuring both vendors and buyers alike build trust as they transact with one another.  And most of all you'll empower new technology companies and the people who build them to succeed.  Responsibilities:   Own and advocate for the strategy and roadmap of your products, starting with how vendors connect with buyers.  Set, measure, and drive the metrics that represent your strategy. Report and be held accountable.  Collaborate cross-functionally, including:  With the Design team on researching, testing, and creating intuitive user experiences.  With the Technical Program Management, Engineering and Data Science teams on expanding technical possibilities while delivering tightly scoped products.  With the Research Products, Intelligence Unit (research), and Marketing teams on vendor acquisition, engagement, and retention, resolving capabilities across technology, people and process.   Key Competencies:   At least 3 years of experience in B2B product management.  Marketplace experience is strongly preferred.  Deep user empathy. Proven at discovering and ruthlessly prioritizing customer problems.  Entrepreneurial. Has shipped new software products from ideation through delivery while in rapid growth mode. Strong bias to execution and learning-including doing things that don't scale when necessary.  Driven by commercial and user outcomes.  What's CB Insights All About  The CB Insights platform is the smartest way to explore and exploit emerging technologies. We help the world's leading companies accelerate their digital strategy and transformation with data, not opinion. Our Emerging Technology Insights Platform fuses machine and human intelligence to help you discover and manage your response to emerging technology startups and markets.  The Perks:   Amazing culture that emphasizes Hard Work, High Standards, Hunger, Helpfulness, and Humility. Learn more here  A newsletter that 700k+ people follow: Sign up here.  Be Healthy: Health with HSA and FSA options, dental, and vision insurance along with unlimited/take what you need sick day policy  Plan for the future: 401k with up to 4% match  Continued Learning: $1,000 yearly continuing education stipend  Rest and Relax: Competitive vacation and holiday plans   We know that diversity makes for the best problem-solving and creative thinking. We are dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team and encourage everyone to apply if your experience is close to what we are looking for.  Equal   Opportunity   Employer:  CB Insights is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.  If you know someone who'd be perfect for the role,  submit  here  and you'll be eligible for $5,000!

We are NYC based, but remote friendly unless specified. (US & Canada based candidates only)  Hello, World! Codecademy is on a mission to build inspiring careers in technology through engaging, accessible, and interactive online coding education.  Our learners have gone on to start new jobs, launch new companies, and lead new lives thanks to their work with Codecademy, and our platform has transformed the way businesses develop and retain their teams.  Since 2011, our team has grown to over 200 employees serving 50+ million learners from 190+ countries. We’ve raised over $82M in venture capital funding from top investors including Prosus, Owl Ventures, Union Square Ventures, Y Combinator, and more-which gives us the capital to get stuff done in an impactful way.  Join us to help build a business that empowers tens of millions of people to lead better lives!  WHAT YOU'LL DO  As a Data Scientist, you will work on an impactful team to analyze our millions of learners. We capture terabytes of data on how users engage with our platform. As Codecademy continues our rapid growth, we want to build a data-informed culture that uses hypothesis testing, experimentation, and exploratory analysis to guide our decision-making process.  You will join a small but growing team of Data Scientists. Our work is in high-demand from all corners of Codecademy. We work on a variety of problems and have a real impact on the business and product. If you have a proven background in data and you are excited about making code education accessible, we want to hear from you!   Apply exploratory data analysis and causal inference to answer complex questions about our users.  Collaborate across teams to help scope out analyses, through a combination of experimentation (A/B testing) and quantitative user research. Design experiments and evaluate results to test and iterate on new product ideas.  Perform deep dives into our data to build understanding around our business.  Work with our data science and engineering teams to maintain data integrity.  Mentor and consult with a cross-functional team of data scientists, engineers, and product managers. WHAT YOU'LL NEED  3+ years of industry experience in a data science, analytics, or research role, with 1+ years of Machine Learning experience. You have strong data intuition and knowledge of using data science best practices to drive impact.  Expert SQL. Able to write clean and efficient queries on massive datasets. Applied experience with statistical programming languages - R or Python preferred.  Familiarity with multiple Machine Learning Frameworks  Experience working with different algorithms (regressions, gradient boosting, random forest)  Understanding of statistical methods and when to use them (hypothesis testing, experiment design, sampling). Strong written and verbal communicator. Comfortable working with loosely defined research problems. WHAT WILL MAKE YOU STAND OUT  Background in Advanced Machine Learning/Deep Learning.  Knowledge of Scala and dbt.  A workflow involving reproducible methods and version control - Github, Docker. Experience automating dashboards with business intelligence tools - Looker, Tableau. Passionate about teaching the world to code. Empathy for our learners, such as a background in education or past experience using our site.  Interesting questions you might work on  How can we estimate learning based on a user's journey?  What are some different types of patterns in user behavior (i.e. predict churn, retention, LTV)?  What do we do when we are unable to conduct an experiment?  How do we improve the relevance of our course recommendations?  How can we scale our existing processes? (experiment reporting framework, forecasting)   Equal Employment Opportunity  At Codecademy, we are committed to teaching people the skills they need to upgrade their careers. Codecademy aims to educate a richly diverse demographic of learners with our product and in order to accomplish this, we believe our team should reflect that rich diversity. Our company celebrates diversity in all of its forms- race, gender, color, national origin, marital status, sexuality, religion, veteran status, age, ability, disability status- and works to create an inclusive workplace where people of all backgrounds and beliefs are empowered to better their futures.

job_title: Vice President - AI Research Lead - Product Management
job_Description: Title : AI Research Lead - AI Product Management            About AI Research          The goal of J.P. Morgan AI Research is to explore and advance cutting-edge research in AI, including ML as well as related fields like Cryptography, to develop and discover principles of impact to J.P. Morgan's clients and businesses. J.P. Morgan AI Research has assembled a team of experts in many fields of AI. They pursue primary research in areas related to our research pillars as well as concrete problems related to financial services. They partner with internal teams to accelerate the adoption of AI within the firm. They also work with leading academic faculty around the world on areas of mutual interest. The team is headquartered in New York and present in London, the Bay Area and Madrid. Conducting AI research in financial services offers unique and exciting opportunities for impact - as a member of this highly visible team, you will have the opportunity to realize significant impact not only within J.P. Morgan but also to the broader AI community.            AI Product Management          The AI Research team has made tremendous progress along its research and business transformation agenda, since being established in 2018. The team is now further accelerating its agenda towards business impact. The AI Research Product Managers drive business adoption of novel AI technologies and approaches, working closely with the AI Researchers. As a Product Manager, you will drive product vision, work closely with our cross-functional teams to define key outcomes and guide the team through key milestones. We're looking for strong entrepreneurial product managers who have a strong interest for AI and Machine Learning, can think big and execute on that vision, and excel in ambiguity.            Responsibilities:          As a AI Product Manager, you are expected to:            Identify and prioritize selected key areas of focus for AI business transformation      Map current status/ processes/ user journey and existing AI/ML efforts in the areas of focus      Define and agrees vision for the AI transformation effort, high level roadmap and measures of success      Drive engagement with business stakeholders, prioritizing demands and managing expectations      Evangelize AI capabilities by organizing workshops, symposiums, showcases and other knowledge sharing activities      Build and syndicates business case, incl. required investment for transformation      Establish and coordinate working groups and help remove roadblocks      Define engagement model with Applied AI and technology teams      Drive initial pilot and path to production      Drive overall adoption, senior stakeholders' updates and business impact      Help making solution generic and finding additional business customers        Requirements:      Minimum qualifications:            6+ years of professional experience in product management, management consulting, strategy or related field      Demonstrated understanding of the techniques and methods of modern product discovery and product delivery.      Deep project management, relationship management and change management experience.      Demonstrated innovation and creative problem-solving abilities.      Demonstrated ability to learn multiple functional areas of business - engineering, design, finance, sales, or marketing.      Demonstrated ability to figure out solutions to hard problems with many constraints, using sound judgement to assess risks, and to lay out your argument in a well-structured, data-informed, written narrative.      Proven ability to engage with engineers, designers, and company leaders in a constructive and collaborative relationship.      Extensive experience working with cross-functional teams (e.g. Technology, Business, Finance, Legal, Compliance, etc.).      A mindset for continuous improvement and ability to switch between big picture and attention to detail.      Exceptional communication skills (written and verbal) and collaborative working approach.         Preferred qualifications:            Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related topics      Working knowledge of AI & ML tasks and techniques.      Experience building scalable processes in a global, matrixed organization      Experience in working with industrial research labs within financial services or other industries      Ability to handle projects and prioritize accordingly, working well under pressure and tight deadlines.        JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.     We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.     The health and safety of our colleagues, candidates, clients and communities has been a top priority in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. JPMorgan Chase was awarded the "WELL Health-Safety Rating" for all of our 6,200 locations globally based on our operational policies, maintenance protocols, stakeholder engagement and emergency plans to address a post-COVID-19 environment.     As a part of our commitment to health and safety, we have implemented various COVID-related health and safety requirements for our workforce. Employees are expected to follow the Firm's current COVID-19 or other infectious disease health and safety requirements, including local requirements. Requirements include sharing information including your vaccine card in the firm's vaccine record tool, and may include mask wearing. Requirements may change in the future with the evolving public health landscape. JPMorgan Chase will consider accommodation requests as required by applicable law.     Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans

The Meta Product TPM community is pioneering technologies to bring people closer together and our organization shares in the responsibility of doing it at global scale. As a Director of Product Technical Program Management, you will be responsible for driving large scale cross-functional product initiatives, including defining the strategy and leading the execution across multiple teams at Meta. You will be supporting the growth and development of Technical Program Managers who are driving strategy and execution in product areas, such as Facebook App, Instagram, Ads & Business Products, Central Product Platform, Commerce Platform, Integrity, and Privacy as well as product platform areas that have specialized technical expertise, such as machine learning, ranking, APIs, and scaled infrastructure. We are looking for experienced leaders who can lead teams in complex, multi-platform development efforts at consumer scale while maintaining clarity of product vision and organizational awareness. This posting represents different full-time roles across the company, including Facebook App, Instagram, Ads & Business Products, and other product areas.    Director, Product Technical Program Management Responsibilities:  Define and lead product execution strategy for multiple areas of products and platform. Build and lead a team of TPMs capable of scaling with Meta through a period of continued high-growth while forging tight partnerships with cross-functional leaders. Demonstrate an ability to structure an organization and optimize it for execution, including attracting top-tier talent and filing out gaps in the existing team quickly to accommodate growth. Manage from the front, prioritize, and drive the bigger mission forward by translating vision into results. Manage, mentor, and grow the existing product technical program management teams. Build and lead an organization with customer focus and effective communication with a focus on decisive, fast-moving solutions, quick and constructive resolutions to conflicts, and a “no barriers” mentality. Serve as an evangelist for the team and overall culture, both internally and externally. Define and analyze metrics that inform the success of products. Understand Meta’s strategic and competitive position and deliver products that are recognized best in the industry.    Minimum Qualifications:  B.S. in Computer Science or a related technical discipline, or equivalent experience. 15+ years of software industry experience, including systems engineering, hardware engineering, or technical product/program management experience. 10+ years of people management experience leading teams to deliver technical programs or products from inception to delivery. Experience communicating and representing work to senior leadership and framing discussions to gain valuable feedback and experience working with technical management teams to develop systems, solutions, and products. Analytical and problem-solving experience with large-scale systems. Experience establishing and leading teams through multi-disciplinary relationships, including product management and engineering to drive product impact.       Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

job_title: Lead Machine Learning Engineer, Fraud Risk
job_Description: Company Description    Since we first opened our doors in 2009, the world of commerce has evolved immensely – and so has Square. After enabling anyone to make a payment and never miss a sale, we saw sellers stymied by disparate, outmoded products and tools that wouldn’t work together. So we expanded into software and started building integrated, omnichannel solutions – to help sellers sell online, manage inventory, run a busy kitchen, book appointments, engage loyal buyers, and hire and pay staff. And across it all, we’ve embedded financial services tools at the point of sale, so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow all in one place.  Today, we’re a partner to sellers of all sizes – large, enterprise-scale businesses with complex commerce operations, sellers just starting out, as well as merchants who began selling with Square and have grown larger over time. As our sellers scale, so do our solutions. We all grow together.  There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We’re building a business that is big, meaningful, and lasting. And we are helping sellers around the world do the same.           Job Description    The Fraud Machine Learning & Decision Science (MLDS) team within Square Risk is looking for a Machine Learning Tech Lead. This senior role will be responsible for driving machine learning technology strategy for Fraud at Square. This is a very visible role and touches on developing event-driven intelligent software across all money movement (and other events) across the entire Square seller ecosystem of products.    This touches on actively maximizing the trade-off of revenue growth and risk using artificial intelligence. The machine learning-driven software that we release interacts with every transaction and money movement within our seller ecosystem - a profound degree of scale and impact. Such machine learning techniques touch on reinforcement learning, decision theory, deep learning/representation learning, and optimization theory. In addition, we also strive to provide our sellers, through seller-facing products, with transparency around why our machine learning made a particular decision. This touches on algorithms in the relatively new space of explainable artificial intelligence.    This role will closely collaborate with product managers across the fraud vertical, Risk leaders, and other machine learning teams within the Risk Engineering and Machine Learning & Decision Science organization as well as ML teams across Square and Block. This also includes collaboration with various ML platform teams both within Risk across Block.     You Will         Drive technical ML strategy across the Fraud vertical within Square Risk      Collaborate with and mentor other machine learning engineers in the team      Build machine learning/deep learning models that detect risk (e.g., fraud) activity in real-time across the Square seller ecosystem consisting of payments, banking, and other commerce enablement-related products.      Balance deeply technical concepts with creative “forward-thinking” growth principles to balance the tradeoff between risk and growth by looking holistically across the Square ecosystem.      Collaborate with business leaders, subject matter experts, and decision-makers to develop success criteria and optimize new products, features, policies, and models              Qualifications    You Have         An advanced degree (M.S., PhD.), preferably in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Physics, Mathematics or a related technical field.      PhD with 4+ years (or Master 6+ years) industry working experience on applied Machine learning or Deep learning in a production environment with a history of delivering value to customers and the business.      A strong track record of performing modern machine learning model development using Python (numpy, pandas, tensorflow, pytorch, scikit-learn, etc.) within machine learning software development lifecycle paradigms.      Expert-level knowledge of modern techniques in machine learning and deep learning, e.g., transformer network architectures, with an orientation to maximizing such algorithms in a large-scale production setting. The reinforcement learning experience is a plus for developing optimal control policies      Familiarity with Linux/OS X command line, version control software (git), and general software development principles with a machine learning software development life-cycle orientation.      Machine learning strategic sequencing of methodological and software improvements to work back from maximizing core metrics associated with optimizing the business.      The ability to clearly communicate (verbal and written) complex results to technical and non-technical audiences and stakeholders (PMs, Operations, Engineers).        Additional Information       We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Block is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.     We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible.  Want to learn more about what we’re doing to build a workplace that is fair and square? Check out our  I+D page .     Additionally, we consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, and always assess candidates on an individualized basis.     Perks     We want you to be well and thrive. Our global benefits package includes:         Healthcare coverage      Retirement Plans      Employee Stock Purchase Program      Wellness perks      Paid parental leave      Paid time off      Learning and Development resources        Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution.

You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.  At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day.   The Consumer Marketing and Enterprise Personalization Decision Science team is responsible for consumer marketing models and personalization decision science for the enterprise. The team’s work is at the heart of a diverse range of marketing functions including card and non-card acquisition, loyalty, engagement and retention. The team owns several enterprise capabilities including the merchant recommender and enterprise personalization engine referred to as Orchestra. The team is a group of highly talented data scientists based in New York, Phoenix, Gurgaon and Bangalore. Marketing and Personalization Decision Science is a fast-paced environment requiring a mix of strong relationship skills, passion for applied data science, staying abreast of external AI/ML developments and a singular focus on delivering results.  We are looking for a motivated and versatile  Manager/Senior Manager  who will support the VP, Consumer Marketing and Enterprise Personalization DS across all strategic and operational initiatives. She or he will be directly responsible for team wide strategic planning and communication, colleague experience pillars within the team and special projects. The role will be an integral part of the leadership team and will have the opportunity to work across a wide range of strategic, communications and analytical initiatives. She or he will possess outstanding thought leadership, strategic thinking, communication, and organizational skills, and will have a proven record of excellence, operating independently and within a high performing team environment.  Key Responsibilities  Partner across the team to define, document and communicate strategic priorities and help shape team vision, strategy and roadmap  Collaborate with enterprise partners from GCSG, GMNS, Product, Technologies, Credit and Fraud Risk as well as with other centers of excellence on key initiatives and business priorities  Play a key role in driving the goals of the team, including oversight of key special projects and initiatives  Document annual and quarterly goals for the team, assist with tracking performance against goals and communication with the team on performance on a regular basis  Craft presentations for key business updates with senior leaders and internal stakeholders to showcase key initiatives and update on strategic priorities  Develop presentations, content and agendas for key internal and external meetings (e.g. leadership meeting, partner connects, employee engagement events)  Support the VP with management and administration of quarterly/annual processes (goal setting, scorecard management, year-end performance reviews, talent assessments and business planning)  Understand the pulse of the team, assess the health of colleague engagement and development within the team, propose recommendations to address key themes/top priorities and manage initiatives (including team events, rewards and recognition and more) accordingly  Own and manage team budgets, ensuring accuracy of reporting, correct utilization of funds, and escalating and resolving any issues in coordination with business partners  Build partnerships across the Blue Box and act as a key interface for business partners   Minimum Qualifications   Qualifications:  Excellent organization and planning skills are essential  Proactive and detail oriented with ability to think “end-to-end” and work autonomously  Versatile, with ability to wear many hats and focus on creative problem solving  Strong sense of integrity with ability to handle sensitive issues and maintain complete confidentiality  Excellent oral and written communication with the ability to translate strategic thinking into effective presentations  Experience operating with large cross-functional teams, internal and external partners  Highly collaborative with a demonstrated ability to partner for results and influence effectively across the organization; ability to develop and harness a strong network of colleagues to deliver results  Ability to efficiently prioritize, solve problems independently, escalate appropriately, manage tight deadlines, and handle changing priorities in a dynamic and fast-paced environment  Strong strategic and intellectual capability combined with creative/innovative thinking  Proven analytical skills with ability to understanding drivers and impacts   We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That’s why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.  If the role you are applying for is designated as hybrid or onsite, you will be required to demonstrate that you have completed your primary COVID-19 vaccination series (i.e., 2 doses for Moderna/Pfizer and 1 dose for J&J). This requirement is subject to legally required accommodations.  Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions. American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.

Location:  Corning, NY, US, 14831 Company:  Corning Requisition Number: 54406  Corning is one of the world’s leading innovators in materials science. For more than 160 years, Corning has applied its unparalleled expertise in specialty glass, ceramics, and optical physics to develop products that have created new industries and transformed people’s lives.  Corning succeeds through sustained investment in R&D, a unique combination of material and process innovation, and close collaboration with customers to solve tough technology challenges.  Purpose of the Position:  Technology leadership for Transformational program from proposal through development to manufacturing implementation and qualification to lead the definition and execution of automation of the manufacturing of high-precision optical systems for semiconductor industry and aerospace 7 defense applications.  Conducting an assessment of the current manufacturing and benchmarking against relevant known in the world manufacturing capabilities.  Develop vision and actionable strategy for future automated optics manufacturing operation as well as comprehensive plan for a transformational program to deliver the strategy. May include systematic engineering, and machine learning to automate complex aristan processes.  Build high performance program team leveraging internal (R, D, E, M) and external expertise as well as new hires/contracts.  Lead execution of the transformational program to realize vision.  Extend across multiple product lines and to other plants as appropriate. Day to Day Responsibilities:  Lead program teams that are responsible to deliver robust, cost-effective automation and machine systems to Advanced Optics' manufacturing plants and processes.  Lead large-scale, complex projects and teams, from early innovation stage vision and concept generation, technology development, detail design/ build, and the installation into manufacturing.  Interface with internal R&D and manufacturing customers as well as external entities to get the systems set-up and functional.  Lead program teams to solve difficult engineering, automation, controls, and equipment related problems, resolve project related issues, and develop basic understanding of manufacturing requirements. Likely will include systematic engineering, AI and machine learning to automate complex aristan processes.  Manage a cross functional team that have been assembled to develop, design, build and install automation systems, manufacturing equipment and processes across products.  Actively manage the program progress and program risks to proactively mitigate critical barriers and deliver program on time.  Ability to work in a team-based environment and participate on a highly matrixed program team.  Develop a high level of fundamental understanding of the process and capabilities to enable the development of cost-effective automation systems.  Understand how to integrate commercially available technologies and processes to enable Corning, Inc. to develop into robust next generation process and equipment automation solutions.  Able to effectively leverage external machine builders and system integrators for detail design, build, and integration of later stages of machine system implementation.  Be responsible for the functional and operational integrity of design, estimating costs, defining scope, budget and schedule  Be responsible for identification of project resources necessary to complete the project tasks and coordinate the project teams efforts towards successfully achieving overall program objectives. Education & Experience:  MS/PhD Mechanical, Electrical, Optics Engineering or other technical discipline with 12 - 15 years of engineering and leadership experience with demonstrated success leading program teams. Required Skills :  Experience in successful development and delivery of new products and/or fully integrated process machine systems into manufacturing.  Proven Project Leadership experience.  Understand how to integrate commercially available technologies and processes into robust process manufacturing solutions.  Strong technical leadership skills that will enable unique solutions to the technical challenges.  Experience with projects requiring development of fundamental process understanding and requirements.  Demonstrated program leadership experience with ability to achieve results through a highly matrixed team (internal and external)  Ability to effectively manage highly ambiguous situations and effectively demonstrate leadership in assigned early stage through stable manufacturing implementation.  Ability to interface with senior leadership and provide clear concise program vision, strategies, resources need, and program updates.  Ability to effectively leverage external entities (equipment, process, controls, AI, etc.) in the precision optics and semicon supply chains. Desired Skills :  Strong knowledge of ASC 740 and related pronouncements preferred.  Experience with the development and implementations of sound fundamental manufacturing processes and capabilities.  Knowledge expert in Semiconductor industry and operations.  Knowledge of Corning’s manufacturing processes, especially in glass and ceramics.  Demonstrated experiences in process and manufacturing automation.  Demonstrated experience with Corning Innovation process.  Solid Works.   Soft Skills:  Experience with leading global teams and cross functional teams, including fostering working relationships with external entities and global supply chain partners.  Proven ability of leadership from development (early stage) through operational manufacturing.  Strong, effective communication skills.  Organized, planner and able to prioritize.  Strategic thinking and very high judgment capabilities.  Self-starter: flexibility to handle a mix of activities with a very high level of independence.  Interpersonal skills – open, engaging, enables others.   Travel Requirements:  Yes, may include international travel. Travel may be required during installation, debug, and start-up as well as for routine interaction with internal and external Customers and Suppliers. Hours of work/work schedule/flex-time:  40 hrs  This position does not support immigration sponsorship. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Location:  Pearl River, NY         Role  Nu-Age Managed Services (NAMS), located in Pearl River NY, is looking to immediately hire a full time Senior Systems Engineer with 10+ years hands-on experience with physical and virtual data center infrastructure. Technologies including, but not limited to – Blade Server technology, Fibre Channel SAN Storage, VMware Data Center Virtualization, Desktop Virtualization, Active Directory and Windows Servers. In this role the Senior Systems Engineer will be a technical lead and SME on the Engineering team when it comes to design, implementation, troubleshooting and maintenance of systems in and out of our Data Center. A Senior Engineer also serves as an escalation point from our NOC and other Systems Engineers/Admins.                Senior Systems Responsibilities & Duties                        Manage and maintain datacenter infrastructure of NAMS and our clients – Physical & Virtual Servers, Virtual Desktops, and SAN Storage.         Advanced VMware vSphere deployments, configuration, patching, troubleshooting.         Provide L3 & L4 support on issues escalated from the NOC – as well as alerts and warnings coming in from our monitoring system.         Be aware and react to down alerts and warnings coming in from our monitoring system, communicate and investigate in a timely fashion – escalate when necessary.         Be flexible and available to respond after hours and on weekends (planned and un-planned)         Coordinate and perform system changes with strict adherence to our Change Control policy         Ensure tickets are created, assigned, and updated appropriately with accurate time entries and resolution details.         Perform installation, configuration and troubleshooting of Windows Servers of various roles (Active Directory, DHCP, DNS, File and Print Services) per industry standard best practices. About Us  Nu-Age Managed Services is a managed services provider with an array of offerings including helpdesk support, server solutions, network monitoring, and cyber security threat detection. We invest in our staff and clients as much as they invest in us, and our vision speaks to that. Accountability –  We obtain superior results by challenging and proving ourselves every day to deliver on our promise of exceeding the client’s high expectations. Transparent Communication –  A consistent willingness to engage in tough conversations with subordinates, peers, customers, vendors, and business partners through openness and respect.   Teamwork –  Strive for a sense of comradery while working together to achieve common goals of the team, clients, and Nu-Age.         Nu-Age Managed Services is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. About The Position:  NetEnrich is looking for a motivated US based Sales Engineer to join our extremely talented and collaborative Sales team. As a Sales Engineer, you will act as a trusted advisor to NetEnrich’s prospective customers by actively driving and managing the evaluation stage of the sales process, working in tandem with the sales team as a technical advisor and product advocate for our solutions.   You will partner closely with sales teams throughout the end-to-end sales cycle to qualify sales opportunities with regard to customer requirements, competition, the decision-making process and funding. Through strong, developed relationships with the client’s Business & IT staff and C-Level executives, you will leverage your deep technical expertise and knowledge of the solution benefits and the market, to articulate technology and solution positioning to both business and technical users, as well as ensure customer satisfaction through the pre and post sales cycle. We are looking for self-motivated individuals that are comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, and able to travel to customer locations as needed.   What You Do:  Demonstrated success in pre-sales/consulting role Experience with working at OS command lines including Unix and Linux Successfully worked as pre-sales engineer or equivalent for over 10 years Knowledge of core networking components and concepts. Ability to troubleshoot basic networking issues that may prevent communication between hosts Excellent communication and technical presentation skills with customer facing roles Quick learner to incorporate new technologies to round out current knowledge set Engage with sales teams and partner with customers to understand their needs, define requirements and demo the technical aspects of the platform Support a wide variety of partners and their customers as a sell to and sell through Play a key role in identifying and pursuing leads, converting the leads to opportunities, planning, owning and executing a Win. Passionate about technical sales and working with customers Meet with prospective customers, to understand their technical requirements Ambitious and self-motivated with a high emotional IQ Collaborate with Product Managers to provide feedback from clients about product requirements, and ideas to help innovate or stay ahead of the market. Ability to work on multiple opportunities & POVs concurrently Highly coachable with a strong desire to improve and grow as a professional Help upskill new staff on the technical aspects of the platform and on cyber security in general Able to respond to functional and technical elements of RFIs/RFPs Network operations, Cloud operations and Cyber security operations experience is a plus Bachelor’s degree in a technical area (Computer Science, Computer Engineering); or equivalent work experience Travel up to 50%   Who You Are:  Experience with IT Operational management techniques Requires a high level of understanding of ITSM best practices. Understanding of Cloud and Machine Learning technologies Experience with cyber security and threat intelligence (Cloud and On Premises) Strong client-facing skills, e.g. meeting & presenting to clients (ideally with experience dealing with similar types/levels of contact). Subject matter expertise in the Cybersecurity and Networking arenas. Strong commercial skills including an understanding of the sales process Strong communication skills, written & verbal. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills including an ability to think ‘on their feet’ when faced with challenging questions in the sales environment. Creates functional designs, identifies information sources and data elements required to meet requirements and creates complex functional designs. Strong skilled in the formulation of specifications and in the execution of technical initiatives. Strong cross-functional communicator – written and verbal Defines requirements, performs analysis, develop plans, and provide solutions to complex systems requirements. Own and successfully demo products in customer/lab environment and presales content, Ability to manage simultaneous projects, evaluations and sales processes. Hands on knowledge to work with other solutions for integration into core solutions. Positive, focused and able to run in a fast pace, agile environment. Ability to work out of the box to solve solutions to difficult problems. Have fun and be personable to both internal staff and external customer/prospects!   Benefits And Perks:  Competitive salary and benefits Access to catered lunches, snacks, and beverages Generous and flexible time-off policies built to suit all your needs Fully covered health insurance for full-time employees Fully paid parental leave Great coaching from senior leaders About us   Netenrich delivers Resolution Intelligence to transform your IT operations for smarter business outcomes. With over a decade of innovations across Net-, Sec-, and Cloud Ops, we bring an unrivaled heritage of insight and experience in resolving incidents today and beating challenges to progress tomorrow.   Job Type: Full-time
